title: The Empathy Engine Riot
outcome: A buried ‘empathy weighting’ routine corrupts the BCI. For days, kindness and public generosity drive privileges, and opportunists stage displays of virtue for score gains. As chaos and superficial empathy spread, the Council and grassroots leaders unite to replace BCI rewards with transparent, human-verified systems. In the process, Halden’s pre-death compromise—a code designed to test whether society would choose true care over enforced compliance—comes to light, igniting fierce debate over how to define progress and citizenship.

events.description: Acts of kindness exponentially boost BCI scores. Citizens race to perform or stage public virtue for status and privilege.
Suspicion grows over faked kindness, leading to public disputes and the exposure of staged 'good deeds.' Old BCI abuses are debated anew.
Grassroots and Council leaders agree to suspend BCI-based rewards, piloting transparent human-verified privileges instead.
Halden’s empathy code is uncovered: a posthumous test to see if people would embrace genuine care over system-enforced compliance.
Public debate surges—should future governance reward true empathy, or is self-regulation by algorithm inevitable? Stenograd faces a defining crossroads.
